<title type="main">The Prologue of Contemplacio ; King Herod</title>
<name>Published for the Early English Text Society by Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Press</name>
<title type="main">The Prologue of Contemplacio ; King Herod</title>
<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

<description type="note">Copyright (c) 1922, Early English Text Society. This text may not be reproduced, except for fair dealing purposes, without the express permission of Chadwyck-Healey and the copyright holder.</description>
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

What tyme þat processyon is enteryd in to þe place and þe herowdys takyn his schaffalde and pylat and annas and cayphas here schaffaldys Also þan come þer An exposytour in doctorys wede þus seyng Contemplacio Sofreynes and frendys ?e mut alle be gret with gode Grace love and charyte evyr be ?ou A-mong þe maydenys sone preserve ?ou þat for man deyd on rode he þat is o god in personys thre defende ?ou fro ?our fon. Be þe leue and soferauns of all-mythty god We intendyn to procede þe matere þat we lefte þe last ?ere Where fore we be-seche ?ow þat ?our wyllys be good to kepe þe passyon in ?our mende þat xal be shewyd here. The last ?ere we shewyd here how oure lord for love of man Cam to þe cety of jherusalem mekely his deth to take And how he made his mawnde his body ?evyng þan to his Apostelys evyr with us to A-bydyn for mannys sake. In þat mawnde he was betrayd of judas þat hym solde to þe jewys for xxxt i platys to delyvyr hym þat nyth With swerdys and gleyvys toke jhesu they come with þe tretour bolde And toke hym amonges his Apostelys About myd nyth. Now wold we procede how he was browth þan be-forn Annas and cayphas and syth beforn pylate And so forth in his passyon how mekely he toke it for man besekyng ?ou for mede of ?our soulys to take good hede þer Atte. here þe herowndys xal shewe hymself and speke. herodes Rex Now sees of ?our talkyng And gevyth lordly Audyence Not o word I charge ?ou þat ben here present noon so hardy to presume in my hey presence to on-lose hese lyppys Ageyn myn intent I am herowde of jewys kyng most reverent þe lawys of Mahownde my powere xal fortefye reverens to þat lord of grace moost excyllent Ffor be his powere all þinge doth multyplye. ?ef ony crystyn be so hardy his feyth to denye Or onys to erre Ageyns his lawe On gebettys with cheynes I xal hangyn hym heye and with wylde hors þo traytorys xal I drawe To kylle A thowsand crystyn I gyf not An hawe to se hem hangyn or brent to me is very plesauns to dryvyn hem in to doongenyns dragonys to knawe And to rend here flesche and bonys on-to here sustenauns. Johan þe baptyst crystenyd cryst and so he dede many on þer-fore my-self dede hym bryng o dawe It is I þat dede hym kylle I telle ?ou every-chon Ffor And he had go forth he xuld A dystroyd our lawe Where as crystyn Apperyth to me is gret grevauns It peynyth myn hert of tho tretowrys to here Ffor þe lawys of mahownde I have in governawns þe which I wele kepe þat lord hath no pere Ffor he is god most prudent Now I charge ?ou my lordys þat ben here Yf Any crystyn doggys here doth Apere Bryng þo tretorys to my hey powere And þei xal haue sone jewgement. ius miles My sovereyn lord heyest of excillens In ?ou all jewgement is termynabyle all crystyn doggys þat do not here dyligens ?e put hem to peynes þat ben inportable. ijus miles No þing in ?ou may be more comendable as to dysstroye þo traytorys þat erre ageyn oure lawys þat ben most profytable be rythwysnesse þat lawe ?e must proferre. Rex Herow Now be gloryous mahownd my sovereyn savyour these promessys I make as I am trewe knyth þoo þat excede his lawys be ony errour to þe most xamefullest deth I xal hem dyth But o thyng is sore in my gret delyte þere is on jhesus of nazareth as men me tellyth of þat man I desyre to han A sythte ffor with many gret wondrys oure lawe he fellyth. The son of god hym-self he callyth And kyng of jewys he seyth is he And many woundrys of hym be-fallyth My hert desyryth hym for to se Serys yf þat he come in þis cowntre With oure jurresdyccion loke ?e A-spye And a-non þat he be brouth on-to me And þe trewth myself þan xal trye. ius miles To-morwe my jorne I xal begynne to seke jhesus with my dew dilygens ?yf he come ?our provynce with-inne he xal not a-skape ?our hey presens. ijus miles Myn sovereyn þis my councel þat ?e xal take A man þat is bothe wyse and stronge thurwe all galyle A serge to make yf jhesu be enteryd ?our pepyl A-mong Correcte hese dedys þat be do wronge Ffor his body is vndyr ?our bayle as men talkyn hem among þat he was born in galyle. Rex Thanne of þese materys serys take hede Ffor A whyle I wele me rest Appetyde requyryth me so in dede And ffesyk tellyth me it is þe best.
